attributes.action: Start government funding for mixed martial arts clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
The Irish government is pushing forward with plans for MMA to be recognised as a sport in this country.

That should be welcomed by everyone. Even those who hate it.

Opposition to MMA is everywhere. Whether you’re standing at a bus stop, waiting in a supermarket queue or having a pint, the chances are that someone within earshot will be willing to openly admonish its brutal, no-holds-barred nature.

The Irish Martial Arts Commission (IMAC) have provided the latest dissenting voice.

They believe MMA to be “dangerous” and “irresponsible”.

They’re right about dangerous, and maybe even irresponsible.

But then, so is boxing, rugby and horse racing.

In fact, all of the above sports have more blotches on their copybook than MMA in terms of athlete safety.
attributes.background: The problem highlighted itself to me when I seen the struggle of a very close friend raising money through hard work and determination, He is extremely fortunat to have a few generous local businesses to sponsor him along the way. rejection.details: This petition seems to be calling on the Government of Ireland, not the UK Government or Parliament, to take action.
